summary: Critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3 transitive dependency with CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability allows attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf messages.
userImpact: Users of @temporalio/client are exposed to a critical prototype pollution vulnerability that could lead to unauthorized code execution or data manipulation.
rootCause: protobufjs library (7.2.3) contains a prototype pollution vulnerability allowing attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf messages via parse(), load(), or setParsedOption() functions.
proposedFix: Upgrade protobufjs to version 7.2.4 or later where the vulnerability is fixed.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or is no longer part of the Mend inventory in the specific branch.
keyQuote: protobufjs 6.10.0 through 7.x before 7.2.4 allows Prototype Pollution...A user-controlled protobuf message can be used by an attacker to pollute the prototype of Object.prototype
